channel.title: other peoples memories
channel.description: Independent Film. 8mm home movies from the 1950's 60's and 70's, found at garage sales, estate auctions and in garbage heaps. An intimate look into another time and place.
channel.itunes:author: oilyfilms
channel.itunes:subtitle: Complete stranger's 8mm home movies from the 1950's 60's and 70's, found at garage sales, estate auctions and in garbage heaps.
channel.itunes:summary: do you ever wonder what happened to your old 8mm home movies?

item.title: teepee
item.description: Calgary Stampede, sometime in the 1950's. First Nations footage. A little blonde girl. Filmed by Robert Punter, Music by Mike Wolske. www.oilyfilms.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Calgary Stampede, sometime in the 1950's. First Nations footage. A little blonde girl. Filmed by Robert Punter, Music by Mike Wolske. www.oilyfilms.com
item.itunes:summary: do you ever wonder where your old 8mm home movies went? Calgary Stampede, sometime in the 1950's. First Nations footage. A little blonde girl. Filmed by Robert Punter, Music by Mike Wolske. www.oilyfilms.com
item.itunes:author: oilyfilms w/ music by: Mike Wolske
item.itunes:keywords: video, 8mm, home, movies, dustyfilms, oilyfilms, Victoria, Canada, voyeur, creepy, indy, independent, super 8, film, old, people, 1950's, first nations, native, calgary stampede

item.title: cletus
item.description: Found on an old 8mm reel, the box said "over-exposed, caput" on it. most of it was completely white, but the end had some washed-out, ghostly images of the family. The film box was addressed to Cletus Kaupp in Alberta, Canada, 1965, and was submitted by Russell Reillander. www.oilyfilms.com, music by Mike Wolske and Darryl Tamney
item.itunes:subtitle: Found on an old 8mm reel, the box said "over-exposed, caput" on it. most of it was completely white, but the end had some washed-out, ghostly images of the family.
